, &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">LISTEN UP AND LISTEN GOOD</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">DO NOT COUNT EXPENSES FOR FIGHTING FOREST FIRES, SALVAGING HURRICANE DESTRUCTION, STATIONING TROOPS ABROAD , KEEPING CRIMINALS BEHIND BARS ETC AS PART OF GDP AND GROWTH</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">GDP calculations is ill-equipped to counterbalance the negative effects of events against the positive. After a large natural disaster ( hurricanes / forest fires ) , the subsequent rebuilding efforts require a substantial amount of development and investment, providing a temporary but MARKE surge in GDP.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">&nbsp;</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">When economists, journalists and politicians talk about the strength or weakness of the national economy, they cite one main statistic: GDP. The metric, which stands for gross domestic product, single-handedly quantifies the output of national economies, guides the action of central banks and acts as the universal benchmark when economies officially enter and exit recessions</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">We need to learn to distinguish between and shift from quantitative growth to qualitative growth. Our current economic system is designed to maximize the former and basically ignores the latter.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">A USELESS ( WORSE THAN PIG ) HUMPLESS COW WHICH GIVES 50 LITRES OF TOXIC A1 MILK A DAY IS CONSIDERED BETTER THAN A VEDIC HUMPED COW WHICH GIVES 10 LITRES OF PRICELESS A2 MILK.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">NAHIN CHALEEGA !</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">A HAPPY INDIAN HOME CARES ONLY FOR TOGETHERNESS AND HARMONY\u2014 NOT PLAYING GOLF OR SAILING ON A BULLSHIT YATCH.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">Using the volume of money flows as the core measure of societal wellbeing is clearly flawed</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">I know how many euros I have to pay for a cup of coffee in a European airport. The same volumeof better coffee costs just 5% in India</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">Distinctions must be kept in mind between quantity and quality of growth, between its costs and return, and between the short and the long term. Goals for more growth should specify more growth of what and for what.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">The one standard measure of human wellbeing today is GDP. It measures no more than the size of an economy, yet GDP as a general measure of success is so central to our economic analysis that our political leaders generally need do no more than announce at the end of every year the rate by which our economy has grown to assure the public that all is well.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">The common acceptance of GDP as our principal indicator and measure of wellbeing has helped define us as consumers. By increasing consumption, so the story goes, the economy grows and collective wellbeing grows with it.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">&nbsp;</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">GDP is NOT a true measure of wellbeing.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">DRIVING IN FIRST GEAR ON A BANGALORE ROAD FOR HOURS AND WASTING PRICEESS FUEL DOES NOT ADD TO GDP\u2014 HULLO PM MODI AND HULLO ARUN JAITLEY</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">Many things are included in GDP that can scarcely be described as adding to the sum of happiness: consumption of cigarettes, traffic jams and accidents, ecological disasters that require major clean-up operations and war. All these could be said to have an adverse effect on human wellbeing while being \u201cgood\u201d for the economy.</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">WE NEED TO SACK 95% OF OUR ECONOMICS PROFESSORS IN OUR PREMIUM ECONOMICS SCHOOLS\u2014OUR THINK TANKS ARE FILLED WITH TRAITORS AND DUFFERS</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">&nbsp;</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">INDIA IS THE ONLY ROARING ECONOMY ON THIS PLANET TODAY. INDIA IS THE HAPPIEST NATION ON THIS PLANET\u2026</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">WE WILL NOT ALLOW OUR HAPPY HOMES TO BE WRRECKED BY NCW AND BENAMI MEDIA</span><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><br style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\" /><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px; text-align: justify;\">THE NAG CHUTNEY MARY IN THE VIDEO BEFORE LACKS A GOOD HUMPING ON BED. .. USA IS FOOLING THE WORLD BY ADDING MEXICAN WALL COSTS, CALIFORNIA FOREST FIRE FIGHTING AND REBUILDING COSTS, THREE MAJOR HURRICANE SALVAGE COSTS , DRUG FIGHTING COSTS, STATIONING TROOPS ABROAD COSTS --ALL TO GDP AND GROWTH. US GDP GROWTH IS ONLY 1.8%</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nCHINA IS A BUBBLE WITHIN A BUBBLE.. MAD MEN RUN CHINAs ECONOMY</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nChina has 365 % debt to GDP ratio. Chinese GDP growth is just 4.3%</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\najitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/08/can-china-afford-war-with-india-come-on.html</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nGLOBAL debt levels have soared to a record high of $ 301 trillion USD</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nChina\u2019s financial system is overheated with credit high by international levels, and personal debt has increased in the past five years.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nChinese credit growth has outpaced GDP growth, leading to a large credit overhang. The credit-to-GDP ratio is now about 31% above the long-term trend, very high by international standards and consistent with a high probability of financial distress.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nAlongside government debt, China is nursing a huge mountain of what\u2019s become known as \u2018shadow debt\u2019.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nShadow debt broadly refers to a type of wealth management products (WMPs) that are sold off the books to China\u2019s swelling middle-class as they look for risk-free savings options preferable to the gambling culture of the stock market while offering superior returns when compared to the savings rates offered by banks.</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nShadow debt of China is 20.1 trillion USD</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nChina is wedded to its economic growth targets, even if that means financing unnecessary investment and allowing zombie firms to shuffle dangerously along</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\nPOOR CHINA--THROW A PIECE OF CHAPPATI IN THEIR GENERAL DIRECTION</div>\n<div style=\"background-color: #cccccc;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">capt ajit vadakayil</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 25, 2018 at 9:18 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_67MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://www.livemint.com/Politics/9fx4v1xGMkvCk05WLP78GO/IMF-sees-India-GDP-growth-at-74-in-2018-Chinas-at-68.html<br />\n<br />\nIF YOU KNOW REAL ECONOMICS<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS GROWING AT 10.2 %<br />\n<br />\nCHINA IS GROWING AT 4.8 %<br />\n<br />\nWE DONT NEED WHITE JEWS TO TELL WHO WE ARE ANYMORE<br />\n<br />\nTHOSE DAYS ARE LONG GONE<br />\n<br />\nUSA IS 20.7 TRILLON USD IN DEBT-- IT CANNOT BE REPAID UNLESS THERE IS WW3.<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html</span><br />\n<br />\nCHINESE SHADOW BANKING DEBT IS 19.1 TRILLION USD<br />\n<br />\nShadow debt broadly refers to a type of wealth management products (WMPs) that are sold off the books to China\u2019s swelling middle-class as they look for risk-free savings options preferable to the gambling culture of the stock market while offering superior returns when compared to the savings rates offered by banks.<br />\n<br />\nThese financial instruments have ballooned into a $ 19.1 trillion market and include everything from investments in commercial property to a small business or a corporate bond.<br />\n<br />\nConducted outside the normal banking system, RECKLESS lending is at the heart of China\u2019s massive shadow banking industry.<br />\n<br />\nAlarm bells have NOT yet sounded at home and abroad over China\u2019s astonishing debt levels-- 365 % of GDP.<br />\n<br />\nNearly all of the country's biggest corporate borrowers \u2014 including property developers, power utilities and energy, construction and mining firms \u2014 depend on the real estate and construction industries to make ends meet.<br />\n<br />\nChinese household debt has more than doubled from 28 % of GDP in 2012 to 61 % in 2017. The overwhelming concentration of China's household debt in the real estate sector has made homeowners vulnerable to volatility in the market.<br />\n<br />\nReal estate developers, which hold 55% of Chinese corporate debt scheduled to mature in the next two years, will be hit hard<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5507970638799862535\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_58M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_27.html?showComment=1517146988702#c5507970638799862535\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">January 28, 2018 at 7:13 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_58MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/08/can-china-afford-war-with-india-come-on.html<br />\n<br />\nWe ask Chinese Communist party members to stop peddling FAKE data about good health of Chinese economy.<br />\n<br />\nFalsifying or padding out data has been refined to an art form among China\u2019s local bureaucrats, since good economic growth figures not only look and feel good but are benchmarks for their career advancement.<br />\n<br />\nChinese local officials become more creative and innovative at faking data.<br />\n<br />\nThe MAD men in the Chinese Communist party has pegged GDP growth \u2013 as a key indicator for officials\u2019 evaluations. So all are measuring dick and declaring we have the biggest<br />\n<br />\nThese local bureaucrats inflated their GDP and revenues figures to help raise debts to finance their economic expansion, which contributed to huge mountains of local debt, a major international concern about the Chinese economy\u2014and the best part is that President Xi knows about this !<br />\n<br />\nRevenues were a key indicator in determining the volume of debts to be raised. Now, as the central government is determined to rein in the ballooning local debts, local officials can no longer afford the charade.</div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_58MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nBut hey\u2014President Xi is NOT an idiot\u2014he has replaced the party secretaries and governors of most provinces and municipalities. Some of the nervous newcomers, left with mountains of debt ( he takes over from where a LIAR left off ) have squealed<br />\n<br />\nWang Min, former party chief of Liaoning from 2009 to 2015, was jailed for life on corruption charges and Huang Xingguo, who oversaw Tianjin first as a deputy mayor and then mayor from 2003 to 2016, was later jailed for 12 years on corruption charges.<br />\n<br />\nChinese press does NOT reveal how many thousands of corrupt officers President Xi Jinping has jailed in his new anti-graft campaign<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5760853043175044965\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_78M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/animation-and-visual-effects-my-younger.html?showComment=1518655729562#c5760853043175044965\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 15, 2018 at 6:18 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_78MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nStrains are spreading in China\u2019s $16 trillion shadow banking industry as investors pull back from the debt-like savings products that helped drive leverage to dangerous levels.<br />\n<br />\nThe Chinese party is over.<br />\n<br />\nAs banks refuse to roll over debts, shadow lending channels blocked and the value of pledged shares of listed companies shrinking, deals that were once regarded as good are quickly turning sour.<br />\n<br />\nShadow banking means banking equivalent activities conducted by firms, who are not banks as defined by the banking act of the respective sovereign; nor do they fall within the regulatory jurisprudence of its respective central bank or regulatory authority by whatever name called.<br />\n<br />\nThese firms are characterised by absence or lesser level of \u201cregulatory oversight\u201d and \u201csafety net\u201d like government funded deposit guarantee and lender of last resort facilities.<br />\n<br />\nIn China, shadow banking products which are commonly used are loans and leases by trust companies, entrusted loans, loans from micro finance companies, trust beneficiary rights, wealth and asset management products, special purpose finance companies associated with e-commerce, inter-bank market (even corporations participate in this market), pawn shops, guarantees, unofficial lenders, financial leasing to name a few.<br />\n<br />\nThe biggest worry is the massive debt pile up in the system (365% of GDP) and significant interlinkages and systemic risk that have got interwoven into the system. Higher leverage and complex, opaque, derivative structures add up to the risk element incase of liquidity freeze.<br />\n<br />\nIn June 2017 the commie govt stepped in and introduced tighter scrutiny and restrictions to block Chinese companies from buying assets abroad like landmark buildings, soccer clubs and studios.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s Nasdaq-style index ChiNext slumped by 10.7 per cent in 2017, as investors went underweight on mid and small caps for blue chips, since the former face bigger uncertainties as China\u2019s financial clean-up pushes lending costs higher.<br />\nBoth S&amp;P Global Ratings and Moody\u2019s Investors Service cut China\u2019s sovereign credit rating in 2017 for the first time during the current millennium, citing debt risk.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s shadow banking sector -- unregulated credit mostly has ballooned in recent years largely due to the proliferation of wealth management products, hugely popular investments that offer superior yields to traditional bank deposits as well as implicit guarantees from the banks.<br />\n<br />\nThe combined outstanding volume of trust lending, entrusted loans and banks\u2019 acceptances -- three categories of shadow bank assets -- surged by 3.57 trillion yuan to 27.8 trillion yuan last year, according to calculations by Bloomberg Economics based on data released by the People\u2019s Bank of China.<br />\n<br />\nThe MAD commies are struggling to rein in the booming residential real estate prices. However, the regulator is caught in a trap as it can neither deflate the real estate balloon (as it can lead to a string of shocks or defaults) nor can it allow the prices to remain at sky rocket level (as it will wreck havoc with long term fundamentals of the economy). Either case public uproar is assured.<br />\n<br />\nEven local government finances are dependent on real estate values as they sell land parcels to generate revenue. Thus, short term gains and political incentives demand keeping a status quo on high real estate prices, albeit unsustainable in the long run.<br />\n<br />\nIn China, shadow banking is actually an offshoot of various credit intermediation functions performed by banks. Thus shadow banking in China is actually a \u201cshadow\u201d of its banks (bank centric). Whereas in the US, shadow banking is significantly a function of the capital markets which is an integral part of the US financial system right from the 1970s.<br />\n<br />\nPOOR CHINA, THROW A CHAPPATI IN HER GENERAL DIRECTION<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8976007277341388779\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_49M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_16.html?showComment=1518794454245#c8976007277341388779\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 16, 2018 at 8:50 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_49MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nChina Banking Regulatory Commission (CBRC) has fined the Chengdu branch of Shanghai Pudong Development Bank (SPD Bank) for 462 million yuan (about 72 million U.S. dollars) for illegally covering up bad loans.<br />\n<br />\nThe SPD Bank branch was found to have offered credit worth 77.5 billion yuan to 1,493 bogus firms via illegal means in exchange for repayments from enterprises to cover non-performing loans.<br />\n<br />\nThe organized malpractice reveals poor internal regulation, a low sense of compliance and an excessive focus on business expansion<br />\n<br />\nThis came after the 722-million-yuan fine imposed on China Guangfa Bank last month for offering illegal guarantees for defaulted corporate bonds.<br />\n<br />\nThe move signaled a continued hard stance from the government following a tough financial clean-up in 2017. The CBRC last year imposed nearly 3 billion yuan in fines on banking institutions and punished 270 individuals.<br />\nBefore the 2008 financial crisis, there was very little shadow banking in China. In the aftermath of that shock, Chinese authorities launched a massive effort to stimulate the economy, mostly through a huge increase in lending.<br />\n<br />\nThis led to a boom in property and infrastructure spending that continues today. Demand for credit increased sharply, especially from local and municipal government-owned companies.<br />\n<br />\nTo meet this demand, banks began selling wealth management products offering higher interest rates than normal deposits. Many investors believed these products were implicitly guaranteed by the issuer, even if it was not expressly stated in the contract. Banks also borrowed cash from other banks and companies.<br />\n<br />\nFor banks, these funds can then be lent to borrowers prepared to pay higher rates. But the banks want to sidestep rules designed to restrict lending to overheated sectors including property, mining and other resources.<br />\n<br />\nThese loans are often disguised by directing them through a complex chain of intermediaries, including trusts, securities companies, other banks and asset managers.<br />\n<br />\nTo earn interest on these loans, a bank will buy a financial product from one of the intermediaries, which directs earnings back to the bank. That allows the bank to describe what is really a loan as an investment on its books.<br />\n<br />\nBy the end of 2015, shadow lending was growing faster than traditional bank lending, and was equivalent to 57 percent of total bank loans, according to a 2016 report from investment bank CLSA. This dramatically accelerated the speed at which overall debt expanded in China\u2019s financial system.<br />\n<br />\nShadow lending plays a major role in maintaining the 6.5 percent annual growth target that Xi Jinping has set for China\u2019s economy. Slower growth may also expose less profitable borrowers to a higher danger of default, potentially creating the conditions for an upheaval. And smaller banks, which have benefitted from the explosion of shadow banking, are resisting the new wealth management rules.<br />\n<br />\nChina vies with the U.S. for the title of the world\u2019s biggest trading nation.<br />\n<br />\nIn China, where banks are discouraged from lending to certain industries and are mandated to offer frustratingly low interest rates on deposits, non-banks fill the gap. About 72% of all lending in China by shadow banks are \"bank loans in disguise\".<br />\n<br />\nShadow banking has at times been worth as much as 91 % of China\u2019s GDP<br />\n<br />\nWMPs account for nearly 20.5 % of bank deposits in China<br />\nPicture this. You're a middle-class Chinese saver and you walk into a bank. They offer you two investment options. The first is a bank deposit that pays about 1.9%. The other is a WMP that pays about 7.2 %. Which do you choose?<br />\n<br />\nIn the past ten years, bank customers have chosen almost $13 trillion of WMPs.<br />\n<br />\nTo an intelligent man Chinese economy is a bubble within a bubble. MAD commies are spending money to build a salt water swimming pool in the middle of the ocean\u2014an ACTIVITY TRAP<br />\n<br />\nPOOR CHINA<br />\n<br />\nTHROW A STALE CHAPPATI IN THEIR GENERAL DIRECTION<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c41367921761548771\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_35M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. THIS IS A STATE SECRET AND THE MAD COMMIES ARE RESPONSIBLE...<br />\n<br />\nCHINA CONSTRUCTION IS LIKE BUILDING MILLIONS OF FISHING BOATS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DESERT-- WHICH WILL NEVER CATCH A SINGLE FISH..<br />\n<br />\nTHE MAD COMMIES KNOW IT--IT IS JUST AN ACTIVITY TRAP TO BOOST GDP AND GROWTH.<br />\n<br />\nSince the financial crisis of 2008, China\u2019s economic growth has depended less on exports than on rising levels of domestic investment.<br />\n<br />\nCapital spending is mostly directed at construction, which directly accounts for more than 31 % of China\u2019s gross domestic product and indirectly for much more.<br />\n<br />\nThe long construction boom has produced dozens of ghost cities with mighty skyscraoers \u2013 more than 56 cities\u2013 filled with empty apartment blocks.<br />\n<br />\nPEOPLE ARE AFRAID TO STAY IN THEM AFTER SOME DEAD BODIES WERE RECOVERED FROM STUCK LIFTS<br />\n<br />\nIncreasing property supply has been accompanied by rising prices. Sky-high valuations have priced many Chinese workers out of the market, creating a nation of \u201cmortgage slaves\u201d and \u201cant tribes\u201d - graduates forced to live in cheap properties in urban peripheries.<br />\n<br />\nPEOPLE ARE AFRAID TO PROTEST --THE LEADERS WILL JUST DISAPPEAR...<br />\n<br />\nIn some super-hot markets like the southern city of Shenzhen, the price of land has exceeded the value of the properties built on it, giving rise to the expression \u201cflour more expensive than bread.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nChina has developed its own MAD shadow banking system, comprised of a plethora of wealth management products (WMPs), trust and entrusted loans, off-balance sheet bank credit known as investment receivables, peer-to-peer lending and so forth.<br />\n<br />\nThe reason China\u2019s financial system has remained upright so far is because the COMMIE authorities have found ways to conceal defaults-- by dire threats to whistle blowers ...<br />\n<br />\nBanks step in to cover losses on WMPs even when they are not legally responsible. Beijing summons up white knights to rescue stricken businesses. If they dont play ball--it is FALSE charges and long term jail..<br />\n<br />\nThe MAD commies know that no good would come of recognizing loan losses as this would cause banks to contract credit, leading to bankruptcies and unemployment. The rule in Beijing is that stability must be maintained at any price.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the state protects people from the consequences of irresponsible lending, then more bad loans will be issued. The result is not just an over-indebted economy, but one strewn with corporate zombies.<br />\n<br />\nMany industries suffer from endemic overcapacity \u2013 from cement to shipbuilding \u2013 and falling output prices.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s steel industry, which accounts for more than half of global output, produces \u201csteel cheaper than cabbage.\u201d Trump will FUCK China soon. This steel is vastly inferior to Japanese steel ..<br />\n<br />\nWE SOLD HIGH GRADE CHROME STEEL ( PARADIP ) TO JAPAN AT THROWAWAY PRICES --WITH INDIAN BABUS AND MINISTERS SECURING FOREIGN ACCOUNTS AND SHELL COMPANIES TO HANDLE KICKBACKS..<br />\n<br />\nLocal governments have encouraged over-investment in industry to generate tax revenue. They also need to achieve a targeted level of GDP growth.<br />\n<br />\nAt times, the numbers are simply made up: \u201cvillages lie to townships, townships lie to counties, and so on all the way up to the State Council,\u201d<br />\n<br />\nOLD MEN DONT WANT TO RETIRE AS THEY WILL BE CAUGHT BY THE NEXT YOUNG MAN--AND SENT ON A ONE WAY TICKET TO A HORRIBLE CHINESE JAIL.<br />\n<br />\nEvery province produces a growth number that is higher than China\u2019s national GDP growth rate \u2013 a statistic which is MINDLESS -- deviced by MAD commies.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_120MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_120BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_120B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_121B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c525766527477020117\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_121M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Nor does the entrepreneur in modern China hold an exalted position.<br />\n<br />\nA Chinese hotel chain owner had the balls to write publicly: \u201cGovernment officials are natural born sons, state firms are the children of concubines, and private companies are the offspring of whores.\u201d<br />\n<br />\nThis is the social hierarchy of imperial China, in which merchants traditionally occupied the bottom rung.<br />\n<br />\nPresident Xi Jinping is looking to restrain real estate speculation and rein in the shadow banks. Domestic inflation is picking up. Sooner or later, Beijing will find that it can no longer cover up the cracks in its debt wall.<br />\n<br />\nUSA IS A BEGGAR WITH 21 TRILLION USD DEBT<br />\n<br />\nCHINA IS A BEGGAR WITH DEBT AT 365% OF GDP<br />\n<br />\nALL G7 NATIONS ARE BEGGARS<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS THE ONLY ROARING MAJOR ECONOMY.. WILL NOT SURRENDER OUR SOVEREIGNTY TO USA<br />\n<br />\nCurrency manipulation\u2013the effort to keep exports cheap by intervening in the foreign exchange market..<br />\n<br />\nUsually, when a country raises its interest rates, the value of its currency rises, making its exports more expensive and less competitive.<br />\n<br />\nWE DON\u2019T NEED TO LEARN ECOONOMICS FROM USA ..<br />\n<br />\nHere's the criteria a country has to meet to be named a currency manipulator by USA: --<br />\n<br />\n---Have a significant trade surplus with the US<br />\n---Have a \"material\" current account surplus with the US<br />\n---Be engaged in \"persistent, one-sided\" intervention in the foreign exchange market<br />\n<br />\nThe US lists three criterion for judging whether it needs to take action against its partners\u2014a bilateral trade surplus of at least $20 billion ( meaning the value of goods it exports to the U.S. exceeds the value of its American imports by that much), an overall current account surplus of at least 3% of GDP ( a measurement of goods, services and investments that go in and out of a country), and net purchases of foreign currency amounting to at least 2% of GDP over a 12-month period.<br />\n<br />\nINDIAs GDP IS FAR HIGHER THAN WHAT IS PROJECTED BY IMF\u2014 AS WE DO NOT FACTOR IN COTTAGE AND FAMILY BASES INDUSTRIES INTO OUR GDP<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/gpi-dog-shall-wag-gdp-tail-not-vice.html</span><br />\n<br />\nIn reality the rupee is overvalued and needs to be at around 69 rupees to the dollar to be at its true value. The over-valuation, it goes without saying, hurts India\u2019s exports<br />\n<br />\nWhile China\u2019s overall current account surplus is 1.4% of GDP, Japan\u2019s is 3.8 %, Germany\u2019s a whopping 7.9 % and India on the other hand has a deficit of 1.4%<br />\nGerman current account SURPUS \u2014 which measures the flow of goods, services and investments is the world\u2019s largest at $290 billion, followed by Japan with $206 billion.<br />\n<br />\nOn the other hand India's Current Account recorded a DEFICIT of 13.7 Billion USD<br />\n<br />\nA country is said to have a trade surplus if its exports exceed its imports, and a trade deficit if its imports exceed its exports.<br />\n<br />\nThe current account deficit is a measurement of a country\u2019s trade where the value of the goods and services it imports exceeds the value of the goods and services it exports<br />\n<br />\nDONALD THE TRUMP\u2014 FUCK OFF !<br />\n<br />\nTHAMBI TRUMP-- YOU WANT TO INCLUDE THE COST OF THE MEXICAN WALL IN YOUR GDP AND GROWTH ? AIYYOOOOOO !!<br />\n<br />\nThere is NO FUCKIN\u2019 WAY that India will meet all three criteria and be called a manipulator, as it has persistently been running current account deficits since 2004<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nPMO<br />\nPM MODI<br />\nARUN JAITLEY<br />\nRBI GOVERNOR<br />\nCOMMERCE MINISTER<br />\nMEA<br />\nSUSHMA SWARAJ<br />\nSWAMY<br />\nGURUMURTHY</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5265234422104956235\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_174M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html?showComment=1550330562052#c4962073224957611484\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 16, 2019 at 8:52 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCHINAs GDP GROWTH IS NOW 4.9 %..<br />\n<br />\nCHINAs DEBT IS NOW 385% OF GDP\u2026<br />\n<br />\nMAD MEN OF CHINA HAVE BUILD THOUSANDS OF HIGH RISE BUILDINGS IN WHICH NOBODY STAYS OR WILL EVER SAY..<br />\n<br />\nThis is like making fishing boats in the middle of the desert and leaving it there to rot.. These boats will never ever catch a fish..<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s construction and \u201cinvestment\u201d binge was funded with credit manufactured by state controlled banks and their shadow affiliates, not real savings.<br />\n<br />\nSky scraper building was driven by state initiated growth plans and MAD commie GDP targets.<br />\n<br />\nThese were cascaded from the top down to the province, county and local government levels\u2014\u2013an economic process which is the opposite of entrepreneurial at-risk assessments of future market based demand and profits.<br />\n<br />\nChina has become a credit-driven economic madhouse. The 56% of GDP attributable to fixed asset investment actually constitutes the most spectacular spree of malinvestment and waste in recorded history. It is the footprint of a future depression, not evidence of sustainable growth and prosperity.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s fantastically over-built industry and public infrastructure embodies monumental economic waste equivalent to the construction of giant dams on dry land. After all China has plenty of cement to export ( after importing it cheaply from Vietnam )<br />\n<br />\nConsider a boundary case analogy. With enough fiat credit during the last three years, the US could have duplicated China\u2019s cement consumption spree and built 160 Hoover dams on dry land in each and every state.<br />\nThe collapse of its construction boom has leftthe Red Ponzi riddled with economic air pockets and negative spending multipliers.<br />\n<br />\nChina\u2019s construction and investment binge is now grinding to a halt-- kickstaring a huge decline in industry wages, profits and supply chain activity.<br />\n<br />\nHousehold debt in China has been skyrocketing posinge risks to growth and financial stability.. The household debt-to-gross domestic product ratio is currently at around 57%.. For households, debt service obligations means less money to spend.<br />\n<br />\nThe year 2018 saw a record number of defaults by number and total value, as Beijing clamped down on lending via both official and unofficial channels in an effort to slow the growth of debt, especially in the corporate sector. The cumulative value of troubled debt is over 3.2 Trillion USD.<br />\n<br />\nThe Chinese government has long forced banks to keep interest rates artificially low, often below the rate of inflation. However, because the Chinese government was eager to revive investment, they allowed these financial products (known as wealth management and trust products) to offer much higher yields.<br />\n<br />\nSavings rapidly flowed away from traditional state owned banks, forcing them to create their own financial products. Since these financial products offer depositors higher interest rates, the banks must make loans with higher interest rates. As a result, a shadow banking system emerged where banks either made high interest loans to a capital starved private sector or to other financial entities.<br />\n<br />\nThe shadow banking has grown at a spectacular rate, and now controls $21.1 trillion of assets or about 89% of GDP.<br />\n<br />\nTo shadow banking system acts as the capillaries of the system getting money to individual private sector businesses. However, the capillaries are deeply imperfect as many of the ordinary savers investing in wealth management products are mislead into believing the products are fully insured by the state, and financial entities have lent lent money recklessly in the assumption they would be.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c4962073224957611484-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c4962073224957611484-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c6220875044811735704\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Marx called his theory \u201cscientific socialism,\u201d not because he followed the scientific method, but merely because it was dialectical and materialist.&nbsp;</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 17.6px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 17.6px;\">\nDialectics is not scientific as much as practical. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load.html?showComment=1525771090590#c7174753694009767256\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 8, 2018 at 2:48 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_4MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCommunism collapsed 3 decades ago\u2014but our JNU commie and pathetic commie leaders keep the ideology alive..<br />\n<br />\nJew Rothschild\u2019s cousin JEW Karl Marx did not invent communism. Radicals, including Pierre-Joseph Proudhon (1809-65) and the Chartist movement in England, had long used language that modern-day readers would identify as \u201cMarxist\u201d\u2014\u201cto enjoy political equality, abolish property\u201d; \u201creserve army of labour\u201d and so forth.<br />\n<br />\nWhat, then, was his contribution?<br />\n<br />\nMuch of his time was spent disagreeing with other radicals, attacking Proudhon in particular, whom he likened to one of the \u201cbourgeois economists\u201d. Far more significantly, he attempted to provide an overall theoretical description of how capitalism worked, especially in Das Kapital, which was published in 1867.<br />\n<br />\nMarx's Das Kapital, fails to mention that money is printed out of thin air and keeps the name of his cousins, the Rothschilds, out of it, despite the fact that they were the richest and most powerful capitalist family in the whole world\u2026.<br />\n<br />\nRothschild hired Marx to draft a social doctrine to invert moral order for centralizing their nation state\u2019s wealth Into Rothschild controlled coffers... Marx saw free trade as positive because it undermines established nations and cultures.<br />\n<br />\nMillions of people are still under the misapprehension that Marxism / Communism is against profiteering dishonest banks and multi national companies.. The Rothschild banking family - the richest and most powerful banksters, for the past 200 years - financed Karl Marx's pretense of an attack on the profiteering dishonest.banksters, in order to fool the masses, and it worked. ..<br />\n<br />\nMarx's hidden message was: \u201cForget your individual rights and privileges and trust in the State and the Trade Unions, and they'll do your thinking for you.\u201d ..Millions of people believed that nonsense, and subsequently allowed 'others' to do their thinking for them.<br />\n<br />\nThe trade unions and the governments are ALL working for the Rothschild's - who own the banks, including Bank of England, US Federal Reserve,and all the big multi national companies, dangle politicians like rag dolls and hold all of the people as tax-debt slaves, through their corrupt central banks and their funny money.<br />\n<br />\nMarx's writing style was a calamity: full of sometimes puerile vehemence, Marx heaped scorn on his opponents, inaugurating the long Marxist tradition of mercilessly deriding anyone with incorrect opinions. In Marx\u2019s pamphlets, mudslinging abounds: Marx's heavy-handed insults tend to make us doubt Marx himself, since he relies so much on vituperation instead of reasoned argument.<br />\n<br />\nMarx's conclusion that aggregate price and profit are determined by\u2014and equal to\u2014aggregate value and surplus value is bullshit. There goes his his theory that the exploitation of workers is the sole source of profit.<br />\n<br />\nMarx's essential idea, was that capitalism would become less and less profitable and that its downward spiral toward the abyss of deflation\u2014lower prices, lower profits\u2014would be followed by worldwide revolution.<br />\n<br />\nThe laws of dialectics at the very base of Marxism are fundamentally flawed-- some are \"truisms with no specific Marxist content\", others \"philosophical dogmas that cannot be proved by scientific means\", yet others just bullshit. Some Marxist \"laws\" are vague and can be interpreted differently, but these interpretations generally fall into one of the aforementioned categories of flaws as well.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_4BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; He finished the first. But when it came to writing the second, on realizing that he would face insurmountable intellectual hurdles ( including being charged of mindless plagiarism ) , he pleaded illness.. when in reality he was fit as a fiddle and going around doing everything else.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nWhat Marx accomplished was to produce such a comprehensive, dramatic, and fascinating vision that it could withstand innumerable empirical contradictions, logical refutations, and moral revulsions at its effects.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe Marxian vision took the overwhelming complexity of the real world and made the parts fall into place, in a way that was intellectually exhilarating and conferred such a sense of moral superiority that opponents could be simply labelled and dismissed as moral lepers or blind reactionaries.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nMarxism was \u2013 and remains \u2013 a mighty instrument for the acquisition and maintenance of political power.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nKarl Marx's value theory and law of the tendency of the rate of profit to fall are a crock of shit.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nMarx does not even understand socialism. Socialism cannot be accomplished only through class conflict and a proletarian revolution.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL DECLARES DAS KAPITAL IS THE BIGGEST TUB OF BULLSHIT.. EVER WRITTEN</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIn the Nature and Causes of the Wealth of Nations, Jew Rothschild\u2019s agent Adam Smith proposed that the free market, where producers are free to produce as much as they want and charge consumers the prices they want, would result in the most efficient and desirable economic outcome for consumers and producers alike due to the \u201cInvisible Hand.\u201d</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nThe rationale for his proposal was that each individual would try to maximize his own benefit. In doing so, consumers would only pay as much as or less than they would value the benefit derived from a good, and producers would only sell for as much as or higher than they would have spent on producing a good.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIn his idealistic economy, there would be no surplus or deficit supply or demand; markets would always be in equilibrium, and the benefits to consumers and producers alike would be maximized. There would be a limited role for the government in such an economic system.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nIn contrast, Karl Marx in his Das Kapital reasoned that workers would be exploited by any capitalist, or factory owners, for the capitalist system provides an inherent advantage to the already rich and a disadvantage to the already poor segments of society. The rich would get richer and the poor would get poorer. Furthermore, the \u201ccapitalist\u201d is always in a better position to negotiate a low wage for his workers, he argued.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\nOne of his notable and more contentious theories \u2013 the labor theory of value \u2013 claims that the value of a good or service is directly connected to the amount of labor required for its production. Interestingly, Karl Marx also had his own drastic, political ideas that were far away from those of Adam Smith\u2019s.</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: medium;\">Adam Smith? There was supposed to be a great heroic Battle of Plassey in 1757, for the British East India Company under Robert Clive to take over India. The excuse was the incident called the Black hole of Calcutta.<br />\n<br />\nAdam Smith ( born 5 June 1723 \u2013 died 17 July 1790) took ten years to write his economics gospel by way of a book \u201cThe Wealth of Nations \u201c , publishing it in 1776. . He never married, and he used to walk like a CHAKKA\u2014as he was an anal sex receiving gay . He was delusional too, sometimes in a morbid manner.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/07/back-swing-of-john-galt-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nHe is also said to have put bread and butter into a teapot, drunk the concoction, upped his ante and made a hue and cry over the quality of tea . Another time our man Adam Smith without as much as a \u201cby your leave\u201d went out sleep walking in his nightgown in broad daylight and ended up 24 km outside of town, before nearby church bells brought him back to reality.<br />\n<br />\nAdam Smith had OCD or obsessive compulsive disorder-just like Karl Marx..<br />\n<br />\nHis house used to look like a garbage dump as he hoarded everything.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/02/are-you-mentally-sick-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\n<br />\nMuch later in 1799, R0thschild would murder Tipu Sultan , and then make a huge pretense of a great war. Therefore, if everyone in the country were able to pay off all debts, including the government, there would not be one dollar in circulation. If there were no debts in Adam Smith modeled US money system, there wouldn`t be any money.<br />\n<br />\n\u201cFamine has never risen from any other cause but the violence of government attempting by improper means, to remedy the inconvenience of dearth.\u201d \u2013 Adam Smith<br />\n<br />\nAdam Smith talks above, about the Bengal famine, he initiated which killed 10.2 million Bengalis ( 102 lakh )<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TOO 4-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_2MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_2BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_2B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_3B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6316195402887733477\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_3M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/comments-overflow-for-inoperative-load_14.html?showComment=1526350970953#c3754499959665712970\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 15, 2018 at 7:52 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_81MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://www.theverge.com/2018/5/10/17340004/google-ai-maps-news-secret-weapon-remaking-old-apps-products-io-2018<br />\n<br />\nWE ASK MODI TO DISCUSS THIS WITH PUTIN WHEN HE VISITS RUSSIA..<br />\n<br />\nIF NATO ATTACKS RUSSIA , WITHIN HOURS RUSSIA WILL TAKE DOWN THE GPS SATELLITE SYSTEM OF USA, RENDERING THEM BLIND AND HELPLESS ..<br />\n<br />\nUSA KNOWS THIS AND HENCE FOR THE PAST COUPLE OF YEARS THEY WANT THEIR MISSILES TO HAVE ZERO RELIANCE ON GPS SATELLITES..AND INSTEAD NAVIGATE ON TERRESTRIAL MAPS.<br />\n<br />\nOLA / UBER/ POKEMON GO GAME ETC ARE ALL INVOLVED IN TERRESTRIAL MAPPING .<br />\n<br />\nUS NAVY HAS MADE IT COMPULSORY FOR WAR SHIPS TO USE SEXTANT AND SUN/ STAR NAVIGATION...<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE ALREADY WARNED THE DEFENCE MINISTER, DEFENCE MINISTRY AND PMO-- THEY REJECTED MY WARNINGS...<br />\n<br />\nWE THE PEOPLE KNOW THE DEEP STATE TRAITORS IN OUR VARIOUS MINISTRIES .. THEY WILL SOON BE IN JAIL... WHISTLE BLOWERS HAVE SPOKEN...<br />\n<br />\nLow-cost jammers placed at the right location can wreak havoc with incoming GPS signals, which are quite weak. More than 12,000 miles separate the Earth from GPS satellites, and the signal power received is very low and fragile<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">India must develop our own jammers..</span></div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: medium;\">WE WANT OUR ARMED FORCES TO DO LIVE DRILLS --ON A SCENARIO WHERE INDIA IS DEPRIVED OF GPS..</span><br />\nPseudolites are small transceivers that are used to create a local, ground-based Global Positioning System (GPS) alternative.<br />\n<br />\nPseudolites are satellite-like transmitters that function similarly to GPS, but instead of signals coming down from space, they are transmitted closer to the Earth and reside in platforms such as a tent, vehicle, or low flying aircraft.<br />\n<br />\nPseudolites' close proximity to the ground allows Soldiers to obtain position information in environments that GPS ordinarily struggles to reach, including forests, valleys and canyons, or even partially within city buildings..<br />\n<br />\nLike GPS, pseudolites consist of a transmitter and a receiver, but the pseudolites' transmitter consists of two parts: the navigation system to tell the pseudolite where it is and a broadcasting system for it to share that information.<br />\n<br />\nThe pseudolite transmitter, which includes a powerful anti-jam antenna, will send out a signal to a modified GPS receiver. The receiver will make a range measurement to determine how far away it is from the pseudolite to determine location.<br />\n<br />\nTerrain matching will use a database of stored maps as a point of reference and a camera to photograph current terrain. The solution will compare the photo to the stored maps to achieve accurate position location information.<br />\n<br />\nREAD ALL 4 PARTS OF THE POST BELOW--<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\"><br />http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/11/world-war-3-sans-gps-and-emp-taken-out.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWE ASK MODI--<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: medium;\">WHY HAVE YOUR MINISTRIES AND MINISTERS REJECTED CRITICAL INFORMATION ?&nbsp; &nbsp;ARE THESE BABUS PATRIOTS ?</span><br />\n<div>\n<br /></div>\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c905470235602106622\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">June 16, 2018 at 6:17 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_15MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nINDIA HOLDS NEARLY 153 BILLION USD IN US TREASURY BONDS..<br />\n<br />\nIn the past month Russia dumped 48 billion USD of the 97 billion USD treasure binds it held.<br />\n<br />\nChina, now holds 1.18 trillion USD while Japan holds 1 trillion USD of US treasury bonds..<br />\n<br />\nIf Trump pisses of China --China can screw USA by dumping its treasury bonds.<br />\n<br />\nIf that happens, the dollar will fall and other countries will follow suit and sell their holdings causing a domino effect--causing AMERICAN EXCEPTIONALISM to bleed from its asshole.<br />\n<br />\nOver the last several years, China has bought scores of treasury bonds partly because it has U.S. dollars it needs to spend.<br />\n<br />\nUSA KEEPS DOING PROPAGANDA THAT THERE IS NOTHING SAFER THAN US TREASURY BONDS..<br />\n<br />\nTHS ORE RIDICULOUS PROPAGANDA IS THAT IF CHINA DUMPS US TREASURY BONDS IT IS AKIN TO CHINA HOLDING A GUN TO ITS OWN HEAD AND SCREAMING \"I HAVE A HOSTAGE \"..<br />\n<br />\nIf China floods the market with treasuries, and the supply of U.S. bonds spikes, then fixed income prices would fall and yields would rise.<br />\n<br />\nIf yields climb then it would become more expensive for U.S. companies and consumers to borrow and that would cause the U.S. economy to come to a GRINDING HALT..<br />\n<br />\nIt will also become more expensive for the U.S. government to issue debt \u2014 they'll have to pay higher rates to borrowers \u2014 while the treasuries held by USA itself and investors would fall in value.<br />\n<br />\nEquities would be sent crashing, too, as yields climb. Higher interest rates would ripple through the entire economy..<br />\n<br />\nA treasury bond is a fixed-interest government debt security with a maturity of more than 10 years. Treasury bonds make interest payments two times a year.<br />\n<br />\nA US Treasury security is an IOU from the US Government. It is a government debt instrument issued by the US Department of the Treasury to finance government spending as an alternative to taxation.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_16b+seedDdgD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_16b+seedDdgD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c1833193299470394530\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. THAT WE WILL BREAK CHINA INTO 4 PARTS AFTER HANGING THE PRESIDENT AND HIS SIDE KICK \"GLOBAL TIMES\" JOURNALIST HU HIJIN..<br />\n<br />\nSAME WAY THE PAKISTANI GEN BAJWA IS THREATENEDENENDING INDIA ..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS BAJWA CUNT MUST FIRST HAVE A LOOK SEE AT THE SATELLITE IMAGE OF INDIA VERSUS PAKISTAN AT NIGHT..<br />\n<br />\nTHE LIGHTS IN PAKISTAN RE JUST 8% OF INDIA.. AND THAT TOO CROWDED IN RAWALPINDI, LAHORE , KARACHI , FAISALABAD , GUJRANWALA, HYDERABAD, AND MULTAN ..<br />\n<br />\nhttps://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/science/nasa-releases-satellite-images-of-india-at-night-and-they-are-stunning/this-one-is-real/slideshow/58165307.cms<br />\n<br />\nWE KNOW HOW TO GRID BOMB PAKISTAN TO THE STONE AGE -- AND ACCEPT BACK THIS WASTELAND INTO INDIA AFTER THE RADIATION HAS COOLED OFF..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WEE TOY TACTICAL NUKE PHATTAKAS OF PAKISTAN DOES NOT SCARE INDIA.. WE HAVE MIGHTY STRATEGIC NUKES ..<br />\n<br />\nIF CHINA WANTS TO SUPPORT TERRORIST AZHAR MASOOD , INDIA CAN KILL CHINA WITH ONE SINGLE ECONOMIC BLOW -- STOP ALL IMPORTS FROM CHINA --100%..<br />\n<br />\nThe overall Chinese debt is currently at around 385 percent of its GDP..<br />\n<br />\nGrowth is a pissfart 4.9 % --while India grows today at 10.1 %..<br />\n<br />\nMADMEN have screwed up Chinas economy.. A big chunk of the debt lies in the country\u2019s shadow banking sector, which only increases the risk of China\u2019s financial collapse.<br />\n<br />\nShadow banking is the unregulated segment of the Chinese financial environment. This sector sells anything from investments trusts to wealth management products, creating a false sense of economic expansion beyond official avenues.<br />\n<br />\nUnlike in the U.S., traditional commercial banks drive shadow banking, or unregulated lending, in China. That\u2019s because the banks have been able to keep shadow-banking assets off their balance sheets, thereby sidestepping regulatory constraints on lending.<br />\n<br />\nAsset Managed Products (AMPs) are the biggest funding source for shadow loans in the country. These are deposit accounts that offer high-interest rates. All major institutions, right from banks to brokerages, issue AMPs.<br />\n<br />\nChinese people were fooled into believing that the Commie Chinese government supports the country\u2019s financial institutions, AMPs generated huge trust among investors ( sic ) . Its issuance is more than 17 Trillion USD ..<br />\n<br />\nThe problem is that a big portion of funds raised through the AMPs has been utilized by the institutions to lend money to weaker borrowers and investing in speculative markets, like stocks and real estate. Since profits made from such investments often fail to match yields promised to the investors of deposit accounts, the institutions are at risk of failing to honor the promised returns.<br />\n<br />\nOther shadow banking instruments like entrusted loans, interbank funding, and Internet financing all have this vulnerability. And this threatens to rip apart the entire Chinese financial ecosystem.<br />\n<br />\nThe use of leverage and liquidity transformation in risky investment products remains widespread in China , with risks residing in opaque corners of the financial system<br />\n<br />\nCOME ON CHINKS \u2013TAKE US ON !<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c7836911040102156366\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_39M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt.
